intro: Podophyllum hemsleyi, commonly known as Hemsley's mayapple, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the humid forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, white to greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces a single, fleshy, orange-red fruit that contains several seeds. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in understory habitats of tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
